get.summary:
Lists all hybrid cloud environments in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions (any-of):
- read:hybrid_cloud_environments
- write:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

get.summary:
Gets a hybrid cloud environment in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions (any-of):
- read:hybrid_cloud_environments
- write:clusters

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: hybridCloudEnvironmentId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the hybrid cloud environment (in GUID format).
It should be part of the provided account.
This is a required field.

delete.summary:
Deletes a hybrid cloud environment in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- delete:hybrid_cloud_environments

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: hybridCloudEnvironmentId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the hybrid cloud environment (in GUID format).
It should be part of the provided account.
This is a required field.

post.summary:
Generates the commands that should be executed against a kubernetes cluster to
bootstrap it to the hybrid cloud environment. The operation can be invoked multiple times,
but be aware that each invocation is going to create new Qdrant cloud access token and the registry credentials.
Thus, it makes sense to call it only if a kubernetes cluster is not yet registered to the given hybrid environment.
Required permissions:
- write:hybrid_cloud_environments
- write:management_keys

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: hybridCloudEnvironmentId
parameters.description:
The identifier for the hybrid cloud environment (in GUID format).
It should be part of the provided account.
This is a required field.

post.summary:
Creates a hybrid cloud environment in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:hybrid_cloud_environments

parameters.name: hybridCloudEnvironment.accountId
parameters.description:
Identifier of the account associated with the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

put.summary:
Updates a hybrid cloud environment in the account identified by the given ID.
Required permissions:
- write:hybrid_cloud_environments

parameters.name: hybridCloudEnvironment.accountId
parameters.description:
Identifier of the account associated with the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: hybridCloudEnvironment.id
parameters.description:
Unique identifier for the hybrid cloud environment (in GUID format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after it is created.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the hybrid cloud environment (in GUID format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after it is created.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the hybrid cloud environment was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after it is created.

lastModifiedAt.description: Timestamp when the hybrid cloud environment was modified the last time.

name.title:
Name of the hybrid cloud environment
This is a required field.
Name can only contain letters, numbers, underscores and dashes

createdByEmail.description:
The email of the user who created the hybrid cloud environment.
This is a read-only field and will be available after it is created.
If the hybrid cloud environment is created by an actual user the information will be filled-out, if it's created programmatically the field will be empty.

bootstrapCommandsGenerated.description:
Set if the generate bootstrap commands has been called at least once.
See HybridCloudService.GenerateBootstrapCommands for details.

status.description:
Status of the environment.
This is a read-only field and will be available after the environment has been communicated with the server.

HybridCloudServiceCreateHybridCloudEnvir.title: CreateHybridCloudEnvironmentRequest is the request for CreateHybridCloudEnvironment function

HybridCloudServiceUpdateHybridCloudEnvir.title: UpdateHybridCloudEnvironmentRequest is the request for UpdateHybridCloudEnvironment function

key.description:
The key of the taint that the toleration applies to.
If key is not set (or empty) together with operator `Exists` matches all keys, values and effects.
The key must be a valid Kubernetes qualified name.

operator.description:
The operator represents a key's relationship to the value.
The default is TOLERATION_OPERATOR_EQUAL.

value.description:
The value is the taint value the toleration matches to.
If the operator is `Exists`, the value should not be set.
If the operator is `Equal` (the default), the value is required.

effect.description:
The effect indicates the taint effect to match.
The default is TOLERATION_EFFECT_NO_SCHEDULE.

tolerationSeconds.description: The toleration seconds indicates the duration to tolerate the taint.

cloudclusterv1Toleration.description: The Toleration message represents a toleration object for Kubernetes.

intstrIntOrString.title:
IntOrString is a type that can hold an int32 or a string.  When used in
JSON or YAML marshalling and unmarshalling, it produces or consumes the
inner type.  This allows you to have, for example, a JSON field that can
accept a name or number.
TODO: Rename to Int32OrString

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

v1CreateHybridCloudEnvironmentResponse.title: CreateHybridCloudEnvironmentResponse is the response for CreateHybridCloudEnvironment function

v1DeleteHybridCloudEnvironmentResponse.title: DeleteHybridCloudEnvironmentResponse is the response for DeleteHybridCloudEnvironment function

commands.description:
Commands to execute for bootstrapping a kubernetes cluster into hybrid cloud environment
`kubectl` and `helm` CLIs are required for execution.

accessKey.description:
The access key for the Qdrant cloud.
This is a sensitive field and should be handled as a secret.

registryUsername.description:
The username for the container/helm registry (registry.cloud.qdrant.io).
This is a sensitive field and should be handled as a secret.

registryPassword.description:
The password for the container/helm registry (registry.cloud.qdrant.io).
This is a sensitive field and should be handled as a secret.

v1GenerateBootstrapCommandsResponse.title: GenerateBootstrapCommandsResponse is the response for GenerateBootstrapCommands function

Identifier of the account associated with the cluster (in GUID format).
This is a required field.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the hybrid cloud environment (in GUID format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after it is created.

createdAt.description:

This is a read-only field and will be available after it is created.

Name can only contain letters, numbers, underscores and dashes

v1HybridCloudEnvironment.title: HybridCloudEnvironment represents a hybrid cloud environment

volumeSnapshot.title: True if volume snapshotting is available

volumeExpansion.title: True if volume expansion is available

v1HybridCloudEnvironmentComponentStatus.title: Status of a component deployed in the hybrid cloud environment

v1HybridCloudEnvironmentComponentStatusP.description:
- HYBRID_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT_COMPONENT_STATUS_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified
 - HYBRID_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT_COMPONENT_STATUS_PHASE_READY: Ready
 - HYBRID_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT_COMPONENT_STATUS_PHASE_NOT_READY: Not ready
 - HYBRID_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT_COMPONENT_STATUS_PHASE_NOT_FOUND: Not found
v1HybridCloudEnvironmentComponentStatusP.title: Component status phase

lastModifiedAt.description:
Timestamp when the configuration was last updated.
This is a read-only field and will be available after it is created.

namespace.title: Namespace where qdrant components are deployed, readonly after bootstrapping

containerRegistryUrl.title:
Container registry URL
Like: your-registry.example.com/qdrant (this will for example result in your-registry.example.com/qdrant/qdrant-cloud-agent)

chartRepositoryUrl.title:
Chart registry URL
Like: oci://your-registry.example.com/qdrant-charts (this will for example result in oci://your-registry.example.com/qdrant-charts/qdrant-cloud-agent)

registrySecretName.title: k8s secret name containing registry credentials for accessing container and helm repositories

databaseStorageClass.title:
Default database storage class, if omitted
kubernetes cluster default is used

snapshotStorageClass.title:
Default snapshot storage class, if omitted
kubernetes cluster default is used

volumeSnapshotStorageClass.title:
Default volume snapshot storage class, if omitted
csi-snapclass is used

ingress.title: Optional Ingress rules for Qdrant databases

egress.title: Optional Egress rules for Qdrant databases

tolerations.title: List of tolerations for clusters in this hybrid cloud environment

nodeSelector.title: Node selector for Qdrant nodes in this hybrid cloud environment

advancedOperatorSettings.description:
Advanced operator settings as a JSON object.
This field is to specify fields that don't have a strongly-typed field.
The strongly-typed fields in HybridCloudEnvironmentConfiguration take precedence in case they are both set.

controlPlaneLabels.title:
List of labels applied to the control plane deployments and pods (operator, agent, ...) in a hybrid cloud environment.
This is an optional field

v1HybridCloudEnvironmentConfiguration.title: A HybridCloudEnvironmentConfiguration represents a configuration of hybrid cloud environment

v1HybridCloudEnvironmentConfigurationLog.title: HybridCloudEnvironmentConfigurationLogLevel represents the log level applied to the hybrid cloud environment components

lastModifiedAt.description: Timestamp when the hybrid cloud environment status was modified the last time.

clusterCreationReadiness.title: Report if the hybrid cloud environment is ready for Qdrant cluster creation

storageClasses.title: Storage classes available in the hybrid cloud environment

volumeSnapshotClasses.title: Volume snapshot classes available in the hybrid cloud environment

v1HybridCloudEnvironmentStatus.title: Status of a hybrid cloud environment, read only

v1HybridCloudEnvironmentStatusPhase.description:
- HYBRID_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT_STATUS_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified
 - HYBRID_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT_STATUS_PHASE_READY: Ready
 - HYBRID_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT_STATUS_PHASE_NOT_READY: Not ready
 - HYBRID_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT_STATUS_PHASE_FAILED_TO_SYNC: Failed to sync
v1HybridCloudEnvironmentStatusPhase.title: Status phase of hybrid cloud environment

name.title: Name specifies the name of the storage class

default.title: Default specifies whether the storage class is the default storage class

provisioner.title: Provisioner specifies the provisioner of the storage class

allowVolumeExpansion.title: It specifies whether the storage class allows volume expansion

reclaimPolicy.title: Specifies the reclaim policy of the storage class

v1HybridCloudEnvironmentStorageClass.title: A storage class available in hybrid cloud environment

name.title: Name of the volume snapshot class

driver.title: Driver of the volume snapshot class

v1HybridCloudEnvironmentVolumeSnapshotCl.title: Volume snapshot class available in the hybrid cloud environment

cidr.title:
CIDR is a string representing the IP Block
Valid examples are "192.168.1.1/24" or "2001:db9::/64"

except.title:
Except is a slice of CIDRs that should not be included within an IP Block
Valid examples are "192.168.1.1/24" or "2001:db9::/64"
Except values will be rejected if they are outside the CIDR range
+optional

v1IPBlock.description:
IPBlock describes a particular CIDR (Ex. "192.168.1.1/24","2001:db9::/64") that is allowed
to the pods matched by a NetworkPolicySpec's podSelector. The except entry describes CIDRs
that should not be included within this rule.

key.title: The key part of a key-value pair

value.title: The value part of a key-value pair

v1KeyValue.description:
KeyValue is a key-value tuple (used in e.g. node selectors / annotations)
The message represents an object for Kubernetes.

v1KubernetesDistribution.description:
- KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_AWS: AWS
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_GCP: GCP
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_AZURE: Azure
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_DO: DigitalOcean
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_SCALEWAY: Scaleway
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_OPENSHIFT: Openshift
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_LINODE: Linode
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_CIVO: Civo
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_OCI: OracleCloud
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_OVHCLOUD: OVHcloud
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_STACKIT: Stackit
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_VULTR: Vultr
 - KUBERNETES_DISTRIBUTION_K3S: K3S
v1KubernetesDistribution.title: Kubernetes distributions

matchLabels.title:
matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels
map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the
operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.
+optional

matchExpressions.title:
matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.
+optional

v1LabelSelector.title:
A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and
matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null
label selector matches no objects.
+structType=atomic

key.title:
key is the label key that the selector applies to.
+patchMergeKey=key
+patchStrategy=merge

operator.description:
operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.
Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.title:
values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn,
the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist,
the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic
merge patch.
+optional

v1LabelSelectorRequirement.description:
A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that
relates the key and values.

items.title: The actual hybrid cloud environments in this list

v1ListHybridCloudEnvironmentsResponse.title: ListHybridCloudEnvironmentsResponse is the response for ListHybridCloudEnvironments function

ports.title:
List of destination ports for outgoing traffic.
Each item in this list is combined using a logical OR. If this field is
empty or missing, this rule matches all ports (traffic not restricted by port).
If this field is present and contains at least one item, then this rule allows
traffic only if the traffic matches at least one port in the list.
+optional

to.title:
List of destinations for outgoing traffic of pods selected for this rule.
Items in this list are combined using a logical OR operation. If this field is
empty or missing, this rule matches all destinations (traffic not restricted by
destination). If this field is present and contains at least one item, this rule
allows traffic only if the traffic matches at least one item in the to list.
+optional

v1NetworkPolicyEgressRule.title:
NetworkPolicyEgressRule describes a particular set of traffic that is allowed out of pods
matched by a NetworkPolicySpec's podSelector. The traffic must match both ports and to.
This type is beta-level in 1.8

ports.title:
List of ports which should be made accessible on the pods selected for this
rule. Each item in this list is combined using a logical OR. If this field is
empty or missing, this rule matches all ports (traffic not restricted by port).
If this field is present and contains at least one item, then this rule allows
traffic only if the traffic matches at least one port in the list.
+optional

from.title:
List of sources which should be able to access the pods selected for this rule.
Items in this list are combined using a logical OR operation. If this field is
empty or missing, this rule matches all sources (traffic not restricted by
source). If this field is present and contains at least one item, this rule
allows traffic only if the traffic matches at least one item in the from list.
+optional

v1NetworkPolicyIngressRule.description:
NetworkPolicyIngressRule describes a particular set of traffic that is allowed to the pods
matched by a NetworkPolicySpec's podSelector. The traffic must match both ports and from.

podSelector.description:
This is a label selector which selects Pods. This field follows standard label
selector semantics; if present but empty, it selects all pods.

If NamespaceSelector is also set, then the NetworkPolicyPeer as a whole selects
the Pods matching PodSelector in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector.
Otherwise it selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the policy's own Namespace.
+optional

namespaceSelector.description:
Selects Namespaces using cluster-scoped labels. This field follows standard label
selector semantics; if present but empty, it selects all namespaces.

If PodSelector is also set, then the NetworkPolicyPeer as a whole selects
the Pods matching PodSelector in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector.
Otherwise it selects all Pods in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector.
+optional

ipBlock.title:
IPBlock defines policy on a particular IPBlock. If this field is set then
neither of the other fields can be.
+optional

v1NetworkPolicyPeer.title:
NetworkPolicyPeer describes a peer to allow traffic to/from. Only certain combinations of
fields are allowed

protocol.title:
The protocol (TCP, UDP, or SCTP) which traffic must match. If not specified, this
field defaults to TCP.
+optional

port.title:
The port on the given protocol. This can either be a numerical or named
port on a pod. If this field is not provided, this matches all port names and
numbers.
If present, only traffic on the specified protocol AND port will be matched.
+optional

endPort.title:
If set, indicates that the range of ports from port to endPort, inclusive,
should be allowed by the policy. This field cannot be defined if the port field
is not defined or if the port field is defined as a named (string) port.
The endPort must be equal or greater than port.
This feature is in Beta state and is enabled by default.
It can be disabled using the Feature Gate "NetworkPolicyEndPort".
+optional

v1NetworkPolicyPort.title: NetworkPolicyPort describes a port to allow traffic on

v1QdrantClusterCreationStatus.description:
- QDRANT_CLUSTER_CREATION_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified
 - QDRANT_CLUSTER_CREATION_STATUS_READY: Clusters can be created
 - QDRANT_CLUSTER_CREATION_STATUS_NOT_READY: Clusters cannot be created
v1QdrantClusterCreationStatus.title: QdrantClusterCreationStatus indicates if Qdrant clusters can be created in the environment

v1TolerationEffect.description:
- TOLERATION_EFFECT_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified effect.
 - TOLERATION_EFFECT_NO_SCHEDULE: NoSchedule taint effect.
 - TOLERATION_EFFECT_PREFER_NO_SCHEDULE: PreferNoSchedule taint effect.
 - TOLERATION_EFFECT_NO_EXECUTE: NoExecute taint effect.
v1TolerationEffect.title:
TolerationEffect represents the effects a taint has on pod scheduling and eviction.
See: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

v1TolerationOperator.description:
- TOLERATION_OPERATOR_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified operator.
 - TOLERATION_OPERATOR_EXISTS: The operator means the key exists.
 - TOLERATION_OPERATOR_EQUAL: The operator means the key equals the given value.
v1TolerationOperator.title:
TolerationOperator defines the valid operators for tolerations.
See: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/scheduling-eviction/taint-and-toleration/

v1UpdateHybridCloudEnvironmentResponse.title: UpdateHybridCloudEnvironmentResponse is the response for UpdateHybridCloudEnvironment function
